1366813163644198919.text:
H.R. 1 will enhance voting rights, crack down on corruption, help restore a basic standard of ethics in government, and make our elections more secure.

After four years of Trump-led GOP efforts to weaken our democracy, it’s a necessary fix. Learn more at https://t.co/EffsvDNUF8.

1366812945292926984.text: H.R. 1 will prevent Members of Congress from serving on corporate boards and require Presidents of the United States to disclose their tax returns.

1366812691168387080.text: H.R. 1 will root out dark money in politics, strengthen disclosure laws on political ads, tighten rules on so-called “Super PACs,” and restructure the Federal Elections Commission to end the gridlock and enhance its enforcement mechanisms.

1366812460003508226.text: H.R. 1 will help restore the Voting Rights Act, give full congressional voting rights to the District of Columbia, prohibit voter roll purges like those seen in Ohio, Georgia, and elsewhere, and END partisan gerrymandering to prevent politicians from picking their voters.

1366812242621194254.text: H.R. 1 will create automatic voter registration, expand early voting & enhance absentee voting, simplify vote by mail, reduce long lines & wait times at polls, ensure that individuals who've completed felony sentences have full voting rights restored, and modernize our elections.

1365054126900580368.text: That we should have been here long ago does not diminish the monumental progress that the Equality Act brings. The long arc of moral history took a sharp turn toward justice today, and I could not be prouder.

1365054126082646030.text: With Senate passage hopefully on the horizon and President Biden's signature sure to follow, we stand at the precipice of LGBTQ Americans finally having protections against losing jobs, homes, or services due to their identity.

1349467662531907592.text: I vote to impeach the President because it is the right thing to do. And it’s time for that to mean something again.

1349467595624177664.text: I do so because, last week, Donald Trump committed the most heinous act ever committed by a U.S. President, and I am one of 535 people charged with holding him accountable.

1349467512086388736.text: I do so because I, like the President, swore an oath to "support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic… and to faithfully discharge the duties of the office,"but unlike the President, I intend to honor it.

1349467422806437889.text: For the second time, I will vote to impeach the President knowing that it is unlikely he will be removed from office before the end of his term.

1349467363469647875.text: Six people died as a result of his insurrection last week, many were injured and far more remain traumatized whether they were here at the Capitol that day or watched from afar.

1349467303906332672.text: For four years, this President has disgraced his office, trampled rights, ruined lives, and fueled the flames of bigotry and hate.

1349467164047192067.text: It is an understatement to say that history will not look kindly on this President. But history will also harshly judge a Congress that failed to stop him and a Republican Party that allowed him to evade the law and believe himself a dictator.

1349467075031556096.text: And yet, while this dark episode was unprecedented, it was entirely consistent with the behavior he has displayed each day for well over the last four years.

1349466997537574912.text: Never in American history has a President taken such brazen, lawless, and reckless action against our own nation as Donald Trump undertook last week.

1349158297111244801.text:
Tonight, I will vote in favor of a resolution urging @VP Pence to invoke the 25th Amendment to save us from the threat of Donald Trump. If he fails to act, Democrats and Republicans in the House will join together to again vote to Impeach this President.

Country over party.

996089150456680449.text: The disingenuousness of Prime Minister Netanyahu’s claim that the new U.S. Embassy is any part of a “pursuit of peace” is exposed by the Israeli soldiers meeting expected protesters onsite with gunfire at close range.

996089148292419584.text: We are witnessing the use of unabated brutality and force against civilians to stifle civil unrest. America must expect and demand more from its close allies.

996089144953753600.text: I am deeply saddened by the horrific slaughter of at least 52 Palestinian protestors and injuries to thousands more by Israeli forces. No doubt this will spark claims that Israel has a right to defend itself — and it does. But this has nothing to do with defense.

738961026352287744.text:
Muhammad Ali is an ever present reminder than the most famous person in the world can be a real life hero.

He really was the greatest.

738960841609994240.text: At a time when fame so often comes with questionable character...

738959954456018944.text: I am just one of the many in Louisville whose heart aches for the loss of my friend, and yet, our community is better for his impact.

738959505682206720.text: Muhammad Ali was a selfless giant who put principles over everything, and never forgot the city he called home.

738959079075401728.text: A loud-mouthed speedster by the name of Cassius Marcellus Clay, whose fights in and out of the ring would one day make him Muhammad Ali.

738958680373268481.text: I remember waiting for him at Standiford Field when he returned after beating Liston, thinking I had never seen a more perfect human being.

738958233352720384.text: I remember watching every one of his championship fights.

738957772620976128.text: In the ring, there was no one better. But his contributions to humanity managed to eclipse his boxing prowess.

738957562796728320.text: He was a man who gained fame in a violent game, but immortality as a gentle and caring soul.

738957303001550848.text: The word "champion" has never fit a man better. Muhammad Ali was a champion. A champion for peace. For justice. For equality.

738956578896916480.text: My statement on the passing of #TheGreatest and Louisville's own, Muhammad Ali: https://t.co/gPWRF8L5Nk
